sense.name: (cause to) turn or rotate around an axis or center
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[theme[concrete]] REVOLVE (PP{around NP[theme[concrete]]) Includes: REVOLVE AROUND, REVOLVE ABOUT
sense.examples: The Planets revolve around the Sun. The giant gear revolved slowly. The principal states that one object revolves about another.

sense.name: focus on, center on, concentrate on, usually important
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[theme[abstract]] REVOLVE (PP) Includes: REVOLVE AROUND, REVOLVE ABOUT NOTE: This is a metaphorical subsense of sense 1.
sense.examples: The '08 race revolves around power rhetoric. She thinks the world revolves around her. Your social network revolves around your neighborhood. The plot of Hamlet revolves about the initial apparition of the Ghost.
